voice: I empower myself through correct behavior.
display_name: Channel of Exploration (34–10) — Design of Following One’s Convictions
keynotes: self-empowered action guided by personal correctness
the power to be oneself in action
lives according to inner truth, not external rules
magnetic when aligned; disruptive when not
distortion: acting from ego or proving worth
notes:
Overview: Channel 34–10 connects Gate 34 (Power / Great Strength) in the Sacral to Gate 10 (Behavior of the Self / Love of Self) in the G Center. It is part of the **Integration Circuit**, the most self-referential and existential group of channels in Human Design. Ra Uru Hu called it the **Channel of Exploration** — the design of following one’s convictions. It represents the pure power to live as oneself, empowered by correct behavior aligned with self-love and authenticity.

Line Companion / Jovian-style pulls (≤25 words):
1) "Gate 34 is the gate of power and self-empowerment." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 34)
2) "Gate 10 is the behavior of the self — love of self." — Ra Uru Hu, Line Companion (Gate 10)
3) "This is the design of following one’s convictions." — Ra Uru Hu, 34–10
4) "Integration is self-empowerment; it is not about others." — Ra Uru Hu, Integration teaching
5) "To be oneself is the greatest power." — Ra Uru Hu, 34–10 commentary

Mechanics:
- **Sacral (34)** provides sustainable life-force power — the ability to act, build, and respond.
- **G (10)** provides behavioral correctness — how the form expresses its true nature through movement and interaction.
- Together, they form **self-empowered action**: the ability to act authentically and spontaneously from one’s own truth, not through external conditioning.

High expression:
- Lives by internal conviction; acts when it feels correct, not when pressured.
- Inspires others through authentic example, not instruction.
- Moves through life with self-trust and instinctive correctness.

Low expression / distortion:
- Acting impulsively or to prove power → misalignment.
- Trying to lead or fix others instead of focusing on self-behavior.
- Losing self-love and collapsing into guilt or conformity.

Energetic nature:
- Integration circuitry is **existential**, not moral, tribal, or collective. Its function is **to survive and thrive through correctness of self**.
- The 34–10 does not care about pleasing or saving others — its power is internal, and that **self-containment is its gift.**
- When aligned, it embodies natural grace and confidence; when misaligned, it can appear reckless or self-absorbed.

Symbolism:
- **10**: Behavior of the Self — how the form walks, talks, and moves correctly.
- **34**: Power — the sacral motor that fuels and animates that behavior.
- The synthesis: **embodied authenticity** — “I am myself in motion.”

Strategy & usage:
- As a Sacral channel, its correctness arises from **response**, not initiation.
- It thrives in freedom — any external control dulls its power.
- Ideal for those living as examples of individual truth, sovereignty, and self-leadership.

Practical notes for your HD JSON corpus:
- Tag for: empowerment, individuality, correct behavior, existential self-love, sacral-to-G integration, conviction, authenticity, sovereignty.
- Connects closely with 57–10 (instinctive alignment) and 20–34 (power in the now) for the full Integration framework of self-empowered survival.
